original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, interest in food, beverage and tobacco sector
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Wednesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.35 percent, or 37.57 points, at 10,836.
The S&P SL20 index was down 0.08 percent, or 2.52 points, at 3,137.
Turnover was at 828 million. The food, beverage and tobacco sector contributed 330 million, and the banks sector contributed 183 million of this.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were Expolanka Holdings Plc (up at 146.75), Browns Investments Plc (up at 4.90), and Lion Brewery (Ceylon) Plc (up at 944.00).

The day after the IMF announced that it approved the second tranche of a bailout, most banks’ shares were trading down: Sampath Bank Plc (down at 73.00), Commercial Bank Of Ceylon Plc (down at 94.40), DFCC Bank Plc (down at 81.90), National Development Bank Plc (down at 69.00). (Colombo/Dec13/2023).
